info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 5 at 4:15PM EDT until April 7 at 9:26AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana...
Big Raccoon Creek near Fincastle.
Big Walnut Creek near Reelsville.
White Lick Creek at Mooresville.
Mill Creek near Cataract.
Mississinewa River near Ridgeville.
Big Blue River at Carthage.
Youngs Creek at Amity.
Sugar Creek near Edinburgh.
Fall Creek at Millersville.
Wildcat Creek near Jerome.
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana...
Haw Creek near Clifford.
Buck Creek at Acton.
Sugar Creek at New Palestine.
Driftwood River near Edinburgh.
Clifty Creek at Hartsville.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Mississinewa River near Ridgeville.
* WHEN...Until late Monday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, State Road 1 south of the intersection with SR 28 in western Randolph County is impassable. Extensive agricultural flooding in progress. At least a few county roads flooded including West CR 825 east of SR 1 and West River Road west of SR 1.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 PM EDT Saturday the stage was 13.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:00 PM EDT Saturday was 14.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Monday morning and continue falling and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued this evening by around 1045 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE MONDAY MORNING
